intro: Apista tenuis, commonly known as the slender apista, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a compact inflorescence. Apista tenuis is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand seasonal droughts.
